newsitem.title: USA: Midget mascot becomes giant dispute in small town.
newsitem.headline: Midget mascot becomes giant dispute in small town.

text.p: A decision by the Dickinson School Board to change the name and dwarf-like logo of the high school's "Midget" mascot has torn this North Dakota town apart.
At least 400 Dickinson residents were expected to meet on Tuesday to debate the issue.
Dickinson School Board President Earl Abrahamson said when the board voted to change the midget name and logo that featured a short, squat, mean-looking character, few residents complained.
But the move sparked a storm of protest from what Abrahamson called "die-hard fans" of the 80-year-old mascot.
"People have gotten very upset over the change," Abrahamson said. "I wish they'd get as excited about real issues like alcohol, drugs and teenage pregnancy."
Abrahamson said the board will listen to comments and make a decision after Tuesday's meeting. He said a new name and logo had not yet been picked.
